outcomes.name: Brick Key
outcomes.description: Small iron key with a complex design. Insert to turn any brick into a small hidden compartment. Bricks can still be smashed open.

outcomes.name: Peering Paint
outcomes.description: Small pot, coats a 10'x10' patch. Can see through up to 10' of solid material as if it was glass. One way. Lasts 2d6 hours.

outcomes.name: Dark Lantern
outcomes.description: 30' radius of darkness. Not total blackness, but a sort of gentle fading. At night, makes it very easy to creep around. Works 3 hrs out of 24 hrs. Doesn’t work on magic light.

outcomes.name: Hypergin
outcomes.description: Very, very small vial. 920 proof. Catches on fire if it so much as sees a spark. Gets any human-sized thing immediately smashingly drunk.

outcomes.name: Fumblecoin
outcomes.description: Anyone carrying this enchanted coin has two non-dominant hands and must reroll all attacks and acts of dexterity and take the worse result. Lasts 1d10 hours.

outcomes.name: Flyboots
outcomes.description: Can climb up or down vertical surfaces provided the wearer is sprinting. Boots lose grip if the wearer slows down. Disastrous on sand, ivy, or gravel.

outcomes.name: Bottled Fog
outcomes.description: Glass bottle wrapped in wire. Highly compressed. Can fill an entire house or street with dense yellow-grey mist. 10' visibility. Mist dissipates in 10 minutes.

outcomes.name: Inventive Pictures
outcomes.description: Featuring men and/or women in morally compromised positions. Fancy magical pornography. There are no new kinks in the world, just new ways of looking at them.

outcomes.name: Cousin M
outcomes.description: Pink rubber orb. Toss it and it inflates into a copy of you. Rubbery, waves arms, smells a bit like ham. Deflates in 1d10 minutes.

outcomes.name: Gin-Drawer
outcomes.description: A legitimate-looking gin measure enchanted to carry more (or less) than the specified amount. Lets you get drunker cheaper or cheat customers.

outcomes.name: Ratplicator
outcomes.description: Complex knot of glass, wire, and mercury. 10' range. Any rat hit by this weapon duplicates creating 1d10×1d10 additional identical rats. 1 use. Only works on rats.

outcomes.name: Loathing Potion
outcomes.description: The opposite of a love potion. Anyone who drinks it will detest the first person they see for 24 hrs.

outcomes.name: Unvisibility Hood
outcomes.description: Soft grey fabric. Fits onto one head. Target cannot see living people or items they carry. Target is not aware they are wearing a hood unless they eat, sneeze, or spit.

outcomes.name: The Gabbler
outcomes.description: Pale blue potion. Drinker babbles for 2d10 minutes, speaking anything they think of in an effusive stream. It’s possible to keep secrets but it requires a lot of patience.

outcomes.name: Peepbox
outcomes.description: Wooden box the size of a loaf of bread with a small brass eyepiece. Anyone who looks in is paralyzed for 1 minute by the mind-melting patterns inside.

outcomes.name: Apocalypse Powder
outcomes.description: Alchemical salts mixed with gunpowder. Does everything normal gunpowder does but with a much louder noise, bright red smoke, and bouncing sparks.

outcomes.name: Slitherdice
outcomes.description: Paired set. Rolls any number imagined by the thrower between 2 and 12, even if the dice are held down. The pips slide about as quick as vipers, hence the name.

outcomes.name: Cobweb Dust
outcomes.description: Small brown bag full of magic dust and dormant spiders. Dump it and the spiders go nuts, fill the area with cobwebs. Harmless but makes area look undisturbed. 1 use.

outcomes.name: Copper-Capper
outcomes.description: Enchanted copper helmet. Illusion spell disguises wearer as a stereotypical copper for 1d6 minutes. Spell is very fragile, not particularly convincing up close.

outcomes.name: Hobblers
outcomes.description: Enchanted horseshoes. Horse can trot normally, canter wobblingly, gallop alarmingly off-course. Doesn’t harm the horse. Used to fix races and embarrass rivals.
